titleStmt.title: A caveat for cut-purses. With a warning to all purse-carriers: shewing the confidence of the first, and the carelessness of the last; with necessary admonitions for them both, lest the hangman get the one, and the begger take the other. To the tune of, Packingtons pound.

notesStmt.note: Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Verse: "My masters and friends and good people draw ..."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
